overview_of_class: This class will involve a close reading of Schiller's _Letters on the Aesthetic Education of Man_ and the first volume of Hegel's _Lectures on Fine Art_. We will focus on two questions. What is the relation between artistic productions and the societies in which they are made? How might aesthetic experience give rise to an experience of transcendence or psychic unity? This class is also designed to introduce students to the basic concepts of Hegelian philosophy.
name: Topics in Social and Political Philosophy
subject: PHIL
